channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Drinking coffee can add years to your life—but only if you do this, research shows
item.description: Is drinking coffee good for your health? The answer appears to be yes. Quite a lot of research shows that coffee drinkers stay mentally sharper and ma...

item.title: An architect of California’s billionaire tax says he’s an ‘enthusiastic capitalist,’ but the system ‘doesn’t seem to be working.’ He’s got a plan
item.description: "I'm interested in how things work," says Brian Galle, who's also worked with Elizabeth Warren, "and right now, it doesn't seem to be working well."

item.title: Amazon is closing its futuristic Go and Fresh stores—showing logistics and tech aren’t enough to make old-school retail work
item.description: The e-commerce giant seems unable to nail the brick-and-mortar shopping experience.

item.title: When AI can make anything, choosing what to make is everything
item.description: We’re witnessing an unprecedented explosion in creative capability. Voice interfaces are removing barriers for billions who found keyboards cumbersome...

item.title: Vibe Coding Was a Ruse to Sell AI Coding to the Enterprise
item.description: If anyone can vibe code, imagine how many developers we can fire!

item.title: Why a lack of governance will hurt companies using agentic AI
item.description: Businesses are acting fast to adopt agentic AI — artificial intelligence systems that work without human guidance—but have been much slower to put gov...

item.title: How Asking This Type of Question Makes You Instantly More Likable
item.description: A Stanford communication expert says if you want to win people over when your first meet them, don’t focus on yourself. Do this instead.

item.title: Satya Nadella Says These 2 Technologies Are ‘Pushing the Frontier.’ Investors Have Doubts
item.description: Microsoft’s Q2 earnings beat analyst expectations, but two key numbers raised concerns.

item.title: I test-drove the new ScreenX movie format. Here’s what I thought of it
item.description: Whenever my wife and I go to watch a movie together, lately we tend to pick a new theater close to where we live that’s called 109 Cinemas Premium Shi...

item.title: Job clingers, beware: research shows you’re more likely to regret staying in a bad job than quitting it
item.description: For anyone clinging to a job they hate, here's a wake-up call: you're statistically more likely to regret staying put than walking away.

item.title: 5 Things Leaders Must Know to Shift from Chronic Stress to Total Joy
item.description: Replace the myth of the stressed-out leader with a new vision—one where joy is part of the job description.

item.title: A once-unthinkable C-suite appointment solidifies Walmart’s new identity as a tech company
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Science Says These 3 Personality Traits Predict Financial Success
item.description: Research shows three traits best predict financial success. (And achievement in general.)

item.title: Bonds 101: What investors need to know about the ‘shock absorber of the portfolio’
item.description: Many investors ignore them, but bonds can help protect your assets when stock prices tank.

item.title: Where is Donald Trump’s strategic Bitcoin reserve?
item.description: Last March, President Donald Trump signed an executive order declaring that the government would launch a strategic reserve of Bitcoin . For the crypt...
